lines.text: I smell bacon, I smell pork. Run little piggy, I got a fork.
What do you see?
I see what the killer sees.
What, like a psychic?
No. I put myself in his head. I become the thing we fear the most.
How?
I become capability. I become the horror. What we know we can become only in our heart of darkness. It's my gift. It's my curse.

We live in a world where too many people won't go far enough... won't do what they know is right... what they believe. I don't know how or why it got this way but the world has become so complicated, to involve yourself in someone else's problems is to invite them needlessly on yourself.
I'm not depressed. Just quiet.

a catastrophe all foresaw but few believed. Most of us will battle too late against the chaos, but not the few, the radical few, who obey no discipline. Unencumbered by conscience, they prepare ruthlessly pursuing their own preservation. If they survive, the rest of us perish.
I'm not here to educate you.
Why are you here, Frank? You're here because you have people that need you to get well.
I'm not sure if I want to get well this time.
Will we always be together?
Of course.
Forever?
Well, nobody gets forever.
one thousand years of the same old crap.
St. Augustine said that miracles are not contrary to nature, only what we know about nature.

There's a system in place. One that constantly evaluates our youths and our lives with no application of relativity. A 4.0 will succeed, a 2.5 will not. Below 750 on the SATs, and certain doors close. Now quality of person, sense of humor, heart; these are not on any applications. It's all about your numbers... Numbers which tell a young person at 18 they're through, and unless there is some miracle of timing or events, and greatness is stressed upon you, your life is over.
Serial killers, mass murderers, it's all genetics. Inevitability. You have no idea about... true evil.
Do you know what it's like to scream in silence three hundred and sixty five days of the year?

You know, that for almost the entire history of Western civilization this month has been a holy time. The Druids, winter solstice, Hannakah, the Romans converted Saternali into Christmas. Imagine that, Christ wasn't even born on this day. Maybe not even ninteen hundred ninety-seven years ago. So no one knows for sure when the millennium really begins. And how much time is left.
This Millennium Group - They really believe all that stuff - Nostradamus and Revelations, the destruction of the world?
They believe we can't just sit back and hope for a happy ending.
Would you, could you, die for God?
not answers, but questions. An invitation to marvel.
What can I get'cha?
Rain without, rain within. A glass of water.
If it was 500 years ago, you'd have been burned as a witch.
Nothing I do is magic, Bob.
Yeah, a lot of people shouted just that from the middle of a bonfire.
[Climbing through cold river, waist deep.]
It's a good thing I already have a family.
[Catherine is in Frank's study.]
I just always feel like a trespasser down here.
Neither of us should feel at home with what I do.

Your gift gave you a nervous breakdown. This gift makes you see horrible images. It's turning you away from your family, from your daughter. It's caused you to turn to the Millennium Group. Frank, you never even consider that this gift that you have could be lying to you. What is it going to do to Jordan? I want her to have a chance. I want a childhood free from this. I want her to know she has somewhere to turn other than within herself...
So you're the guy that caught the guy...
Leon Cole Pigget.
I was always curious - how did he prepare them?
In a skillet with potatoes and onions.
Someone pulled a John Wayne Bobbit, post mortem.
It's not an uncommon mutilation.
Well, that's comforting.
He's a damn saint.
Or worse.
I'm having these nightmares, visions, that are the manifestation of pure evil.
We all make believe.
The killer doesn't see the world like everyone else.
How does he see it?
Differently.
All I ask is that I go before my daughter.
Unlike profiling serial killers, writing is a lonely and depressing profession.
I feel nothing. There's nothing inside. None of this is real.
The time is near.
[The Old Man's Millennium Group password on a micro cassette recording wielded by Peter Watts]
There's no such thing as an ex-Marine.
Everybody's got a theory on the increasing violence in our society.
My wife thinks it's the artificial hormones in beef.
What's your take?
I don't think it's the beef.
We must respect evil, and we must make evil respect us.
[entering his voice activated computer password]
My God, it's full of stars.
